intro: Cistanthera kabingaensis, commonly known as the Kabinga sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cistaceae, which includes various species of flowering plants adapted to dry environments. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and are arranged in clusters. Cistanthera kabingaensis is well adapted to sandy soils and can survive in areas with limited rainfall.
